sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom'; import VideoPlayer from './VideoPlayer'; import './BlogPost.css'; // Blog post content data const blogPostData = { 'contact-views': { title: 'How to Set Up Contact Views', videoUrl: 'https://www.loom.com/embed/3c1110ecb5b745338d3cd0e011be26f8', content: ( <>

Access Contacts:

Navigate to the Contacts section.
Tip: Pin this page in your bookmarks for quick access.

Add a New View:

Click the Add View button.
Search for the pre-made views (look for names that include "copy").
Note: If the view isn't available, reach out for help.

Configure View Columns:

If your view doesn't automatically include the same columns as shown in the example, click Edit Columns.
Add the required columns.
Optionally, freeze key columns (e.g., the first few) so they remain visible as you scroll.

Customize Filters:

Note: Our workflow has been updated! The video demonstrates the old method using List Membership, but we now use Advanced Filters instead.

In the view, click on "Advanced Filters".
Set up filters as shown in the example below:
- Lead Class is any of Attempts-1
- First Contact Owner v1 is equal to any of [your name]
- Date entered "Marketing Qualified Lead (Lifecycle Stage Pipeline)" is less than 10 days ago



For Copy Views:
Click Clone View first.
Once cloned, remove "copy" (or "clone") from the view name.
Set the view to Private if you don't want others to edit it.
Click Save once the filters are set.

Review Specific Views:

Check views like All Leads and Attempt Zero (or your equivalent) to ensure they display your leads correctly.
Some lists might initially show no results until adjustments (e.g., setting attempts to zero by default) are completed.

Use the Preview Button:

Click the Preview button on a contact to quickly view details without opening new tabs.
Use the Call option in the preview. (Note: Ensure your HubSpot extension is set up if you want to receive inbound calls.)

Customize Contact Properties (Left Side Panel):

On the contact page, click Actions > Customize Properties.
Click Add Property to include additional fields.
Drag new properties to reorder them as needed for easy viewing.

Utilize Inside Sales Notes:

Use the inside sales notes to track and analyze sales rep feedback (e.g., reasons for rejecting leads).
This helps in understanding trends (like non-homeowners or other common issues) and communicating effectively with the marketing team.

Final Checks:

Verify all settings across different areas (main view and preview mode) to ensure consistency.
Reach out with any questions or issues.

Happy organizing!

) }, 'lead-management': { title: 'Lead Management Best Practices', videoUrl: 'https://www.loom.com/embed/3c1110ecb5b745338d3cd0e011be26f8', // Replace with actual video URL content: ( <>

Introduction to Lead Management

Effective lead management is crucial for sales success. This guide covers best practices for managing leads in our system.

Prioritizing Leads

Not all leads are created equal. Learn how to prioritize leads based on:

  • Lead score
  • Engagement level
  • Fit with ideal customer profile

Follow-up Strategies

Consistent follow-up is key to converting leads. Implement these strategies:

  • Respond to new leads within 5 minutes when possible
  • Use a multi-channel approach (email, phone, social)
  • Follow the 6-touch minimum rule before considering a lead cold

Lead Nurturing

Not all leads are ready to buy immediately. Nurture leads by:

  • Sending relevant content based on their interests
  • Maintaining regular but non-intrusive communication
  • Providing value in every interaction

Lead Conversion

Converting leads to customers requires:

  • Understanding their specific needs
  • Addressing objections effectively
  • Presenting solutions tailored to their situation

) }, 'sales-automation': { title: 'Sales Automation Tips', videoUrl: 'https://www.loom.com/embed/3c1110ecb5b745338d3cd0e011be26f8', // Replace with actual video URL content: ( <>

Introduction to Sales Automation

Sales automation can significantly increase your productivity and effectiveness. This guide covers key automation strategies.

Email Sequence Automation

Set up effective email sequences that:

  • Trigger based on specific actions or timeframes
  • Personalize content for each recipient
  • Include clear calls-to-action

Task Automation

Automate routine tasks to save time:

  • Set up automatic follow-up reminders
  • Create workflows for lead qualification
  • Automate data entry where possible

Reporting Automation

Streamline your reporting process:

  • Schedule automated reports
  • Set up dashboards for real-time monitoring
  • Create alerts for important metrics

) }, 'reporting': { title: 'Creating Effective Reports', videoUrl: 'https://www.loom.com/embed/3c1110ecb5b745338d3cd0e011be26f8', // Replace with actual video URL content: ( <>

Introduction to Reporting

Effective reporting helps track progress and make data-driven decisions. This guide covers best practices for creating useful reports.

Key Metrics to Track

Focus on these essential metrics:

  • Lead conversion rates
  • Sales cycle length
  • Revenue by source
  • Activity metrics (calls, emails, meetings)

Report Design

Create reports that are:

  • Clear and easy to understand
  • Focused on actionable insights
  • Visually appealing with charts and graphs

Report Frequency

Determine the right cadence for different reports:

  • Daily activity reports
  • Weekly pipeline updates
  • Monthly performance reviews
  • Quarterly trend analysis

) } }; const BlogPost = () => { const { viewId } = useParams(); // Default to contact-views if the viewId doesn't match any known blog post const currentPost = blogPostData[viewId] || blogPostData['contact-views']; return (

{currentPost.title}

{currentPost.content}
); }; export default BlogPost;
